archimate:ApplicationComponent.documentation:
Picture Archiving and Communication System (PACS)
A system for storing, retrieving, and sharing medical images. Core Functionalities: • Image storage (X-ray, CT, MRI, PET, Ultrasound) • Secure viewing and sharing of images • DICOM (Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine) compliance • Integration with RIS for image reports
Workflows: • Image capture → DICOM tagging → Storage in PACS → Retrieval via RIS/EHR
Data Types: • DICOM images, metadata, access logs
Integration Points: • RIS: Imaging reports • EHR: Embedding images in patient records • HIS: Linking image orders to patients
Example Software: • Sectra PACS • Philips IntelliSpace PACS • Merge PACS (IBM) • Agfa HealthCare PACS
• Relationships:
o Stores data in → Storage SAN: Requires large storage capacity for images o Integrates with → EHR: Makes images available in patient records o Used by → Radiology Department: Primary system for radiologists o Requires → High Bandwidth Network: For transferring large image files
